title: Aetna Bariatric Surgery Medical Necessity Criteria
content:
Aetna considers bariatric surgery medically necessary when ALL of the following criteria are met:

1. BMI Criteria (at least one):
   - BMI ≥ 40 without comorbidities, OR
   - BMI ≥ 35 with at least ONE of the following:
     * Type 2 diabetes
     * Hypertension
     * Obstructive sleep apnea
     * Dyslipidemia
     * Cardiovascular disease

2. Age Requirements:
   - Age 18-65 years
   - Consideration for ages 13-17 with severe obesity and life-threatening comorbidities

3. Conservative Treatment History:
   - Documented participation in physician-supervised weight loss program for at least 6 consecutive months within the past 2 years
   - Program must include nutritional counseling and increased physical activity

4. Psychological Evaluation:
   - Comprehensive psychological assessment by licensed mental health professional
   - Assessment of eating behaviors, motivation, and support system
   - No untreated psychiatric conditions that would interfere with adherence

5. Multidisciplinary Team:
   - Evaluation by surgeon, nutritionist, and behavioral health specialist
   - Member must demonstrate understanding of procedure, lifestyle changes, and commitment

6. Medical Optimization:
   - Medical conditions optimized prior to surgery
   - Smoking cessation for at least 6 weeks prior to surgery
   - No substance abuse in past 12 months

7. Centers of Excellence:
   - Surgery performed at Aetna-designated Center of Excellence
   - Surgeon must be board-certified with documented bariatric experience

Covered Procedures:
- Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass
- Laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy
- Laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding (select cases)

Not Covered:
- Revision bariatric surgery (except complications)
- Duodenal switch as primary procedure
- Endoscopic procedures for weight loss

sections.coverage criteria: BMI ≥40 or BMI ≥35 with comorbidities (diabetes, hypertension, sleep apnea). Age 18-65. 6-month supervised weight loss. Psychological evaluation. Center of Excellence required.
sections.prior authorization: Required. Must submit 6-month weight loss documentation, psychological evaluation, multidisciplinary team notes.
sections.limitations: Surgery at Aetna Centers of Excellence only. Board-certified surgeon required. Revision surgery not covered except complications.

title: Aetna Advanced Imaging Prior Authorization Policy
content:
Aetna requires prior authorization for high-tech diagnostic imaging to ensure appropriate utilization:

1. MRI Authorization Requirements:
   - Brain MRI: Required (except emergency/stroke protocol)
   - Spine MRI: Required for all regions
   - Musculoskeletal MRI: Required (shoulder, knee, hip, ankle, wrist)
   - Cardiac MRI: Required
   - Abdomen/Pelvis MRI: Required

2. CT Scan Authorization:
   - CT Angiography: Required
   - Cardiac CT: Required
   - Virtual colonoscopy: Required
   - Body CT screening: Not covered

3. PET Scan Authorization:
   - All PET scans require prior authorization
   - Oncology PET: Covered for staging/restaging specific cancers
   - Cardiac PET: Covered for viability assessment
   - Brain PET: Limited to dementia evaluation

4. Clinical Appropriateness Criteria:
   - Conservative therapy attempted (when clinically appropriate)
   - Imaging expected to impact treatment decisions
   - Alternative less costly imaging not suitable
   - Clinical indication supports imaging choice

5. Authorization Process:
   - Online submission through Aetna provider portal
   - Response within 24-48 hours for routine cases
   - Urgent cases reviewed within 24 hours
   - Emergency cases reviewed retrospectively

6. Exceptions (No Authorization Needed):
   - Emergency department imaging
   - Inpatient imaging
   - Observation status imaging
   - Trauma cases

sections.coverage determination: Prior authorization required for MRI, CT angiography, cardiac CT, all PET scans. Emergency, inpatient, and observation cases exempt.
sections.authorization process: Submit via provider portal. 24-48 hours routine, 24 hours urgent, retrospective for emergency.
sections.clinical criteria: Conservative therapy attempted, imaging impacts treatment, less costly alternative not suitable.

title: Aetna Genetic Testing Coverage Policy
content:
Aetna covers genetic testing when medical necessity criteria are established:

1. BRCA Testing - Covered for:
   - Personal history breast cancer age ≤45
   - Breast cancer age ≤50 with Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry
   - Triple-negative breast cancer age ≤60
   - Ovarian/fallopian tube/primary peritoneal cancer
   - Male breast cancer
   - Pancreatic cancer with family history of BRCA
   - Metastatic prostate cancer
   - First-degree relative with known BRCA mutation

2. Hereditary Cancer Panel Testing:
   - Multi-gene panels covered when BRCA criteria met
   - Panel must be targeted to personal/family cancer history
   - Whole exome/genome sequencing not covered for cancer risk

3. Lynch Syndrome Testing:
   - Colorectal cancer diagnosed age <50
   - Endometrial cancer diagnosed age <50
   - Amsterdam criteria met
   - Bethesda guidelines criteria met
   - Universal tumor screening recommended

4. Prior Authorization Requirements:
   - All genetic testing requires authorization
   - Submit detailed 3-generation family history
   - Genetic counseling documentation required

5. Genetic Counseling:
   - Pre-test counseling by certified genetic counselor or medical geneticist REQUIRED
   - Post-test counseling recommended
   - Telehealth genetic counseling covered

6. Coverage Limitations:
   - Test most informative family member first (affected individual)
   - Predictive testing for family members covered after mutation identified
   - Repeat testing NOT covered without new diagnosis
   - Direct-to-consumer testing NOT covered
   - Variant of uncertain significance (VUS) re-classification updates covered annually

sections.coverage criteria: BRCA: breast cancer ≤45, ovarian cancer, male breast cancer, family history. Lynch: colorectal/endometrial <50, Amsterdam/Bethesda criteria. Requires pre-test genetic counseling.
sections.prior authorization: Required. Submit 3-generation family history, genetic counseling documentation.
sections.limitations: Test affected individual first. Predictive testing after mutation ID'd. No repeat testing. No direct-to-consumer. VUS updates annually.
